001package squidpony.squidgrid.mapping;
002
003import squidpony.ArrayTools;
004import squidpony.squidmath.Coord;
005import squidpony.squidmath.GreasedRegion;
006import squidpony.squidmath.OrderedMap;
007import squidpony.squidmath.OrderedSet;
008
009import java.util.ArrayList;
010import java.util.Arrays;
011import java.util.List;
012
013/**
014 * A small class that can analyze a dungeon or other map and identify areas as being "room" or "corridor" based on how
015 * thick the walkable areas are (corridors are at most 2 cells wide at their widest, rooms are anything else). Most
016 * methods of this class return 2D char arrays or Lists thereof, with the subset of the map that is in a specific region
017 * kept the same, but everything else replaced with '#'.
018 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 2/3/2016.
019 * 
020 * @see RectangleRoomFinder A simpler but faster alternative
021 */
022public class RoomFinder {
023    /**
024     * A copy of the dungeon map, however it was passed to the constructor.
025     */
026    public char[][] map,
027    /**
028     * A simplified version of the dungeon map, using '#' for walls and '.' for floors.
029     */
030    basic;
031
032    public int[][] environment;
033    /**
034     * Not likely to be used directly, but there may be things you can do with these that are cumbersome using only
035     * RoomFinder's simpler API.
036     */
037    public OrderedMap<GreasedRegion, List<GreasedRegion>> rooms,
038    /**
039     * Not likely to be used directly, but there may be things you can do with these that are cumbersome using only
040     * RoomFinder's simpler API.
041     */
042    corridors,
043    /**
044     * Not likely to be used directly, but there may be things you can do with these that are cumbersome using only
045     * RoomFinder's simpler API. Won't be assigned a value if this class is constructed with a 2D char array; it needs
046     * the two-arg constructor using the environment produced by a MixedGenerator, SerpentMapGenerator, or similar.
047     */
048    caves;
049
050    public GreasedRegion allRooms, allCaves, allCorridors, allFloors;
051
052    /**
053     * When a RoomFinder is constructed, it stores all points of rooms that are adjacent to another region here.
054     */
055    public Coord[] connections,
056    /**
057     * Potential doorways, where a room is adjacent to a corridor.
058     */
059    doorways,
060    /**
061     * Cave mouths, where a cave is adjacent to another type of terrain.
062     */
063    mouths;
064    public int width, height;
065
066    /**
067     * Constructs a RoomFinder given a dungeon map, and finds rooms, corridors, and their connections on the map. Does
068     * not find caves; if a collection of caves is requested from this, it will be non-null but empty.
069     * @param dungeon a 2D char array that uses '#', box drawing characters, or ' ' for walls.
070     */
071    public RoomFinder(char[][] dungeon)
072    {
073        if(dungeon.length <= 0)
074            return;
075        width = dungeon.length;
076        height = dungeon[0].length;
077        map = new char[width][height];
078        environment = new int[width][height];
079        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
080            System.arraycopy(dungeon[i], 0, map[i], 0, height);
081        }
082        rooms = new OrderedMap<>(32);
083        corridors = new OrderedMap<>(32);
084        caves = new OrderedMap<>(8);
085        basic = DungeonUtility.simplifyDungeon(map);
086        allFloors = new GreasedRegion(basic, '.');
087        allRooms = allFloors.copy().retract8way().flood(allFloors, 2);
088        allCorridors = allFloors.copy().andNot(allRooms);
089
090        environment = allCorridors.writeInts(
091                allRooms.writeInts(environment, DungeonUtility.ROOM_FLOOR),
092                DungeonUtility.CORRIDOR_FLOOR);
093
094        allCaves = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
095        GreasedRegion d = allCorridors.copy().fringe().and(allRooms);
096        connections = doorways = d.asCoords();
097        mouths = new Coord[0];
098        List<GreasedRegion> rs = allRooms.split(), cs = allCorridors.split();
099
100        for (GreasedRegion sep : cs) {
101            GreasedRegion someDoors = sep.copy().fringe().and(allRooms);
102            Coord[] doors = someDoors.asCoords();
103            List<GreasedRegion> near = new ArrayList<>(4);
104            for (int i = 0; i < doors.length; i++) {
105                near.addAll(GreasedRegion.whichContain(doors[i].x, doors[i].y, rs));
106            }
107            corridors.put(sep, near);
108        }
109
110        for (GreasedRegion sep : rs) {
111            GreasedRegion aroundDoors = sep.copy().fringe().and(allCorridors);
112            Coord[] doors = aroundDoors.asCoords();
113            List<GreasedRegion> near = new ArrayList<>(10);
114            for (int i = 0; i < doors.length; i++) {
115                near.addAll(GreasedRegion.whichContain(doors[i].x, doors[i].y, cs));
116            }
117            rooms.put(sep, near);
118        }
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * Constructs a RoomFinder given a dungeon map and a general kind of environment for the whole map, then finds
123     * rooms, corridors, and their connections on the map. Defaults to treating all areas as cave unless
124     * {@code environmentKind} is {@code MixedGenerator.ROOM_FLOOR} (or its equivalent, 1).
125     * @param dungeon a 2D char array that uses '#', box drawing characters, or ' ' for walls.
126     * @param environmentKind if 1 ({@code MixedGenerator.ROOM_FLOOR}), this will find rooms and corridors, else caves
127     */
128    public RoomFinder(char[][] dungeon, int environmentKind)
129    {
130        if(dungeon.length <= 0)
131            return;
132        width = dungeon.length;
133        height = dungeon[0].length;
134        map = new char[width][height];
135        environment = new int[width][height];
136        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
137            System.arraycopy(dungeon[i], 0, map[i], 0, height);
138        }
139        rooms = new OrderedMap<>(32);
140        corridors = new OrderedMap<>(32);
141        caves = new OrderedMap<>(8);
142
143        basic = DungeonUtility.simplifyDungeon(map);
144
145        if(environmentKind == DungeonUtility.ROOM_FLOOR) {
146
147            allFloors = new GreasedRegion(basic, '.');
148            allRooms = allFloors.copy().retract8way().flood(allFloors, 2);
149            allCorridors = allFloors.copy().andNot(allRooms);
150            allCaves = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
151
152            environment = allCorridors.writeInts(
153                    allRooms.writeInts(environment, DungeonUtility.ROOM_FLOOR),
154                    DungeonUtility.CORRIDOR_FLOOR);
155
156
157            GreasedRegion d = allCorridors.copy().fringe().and(allRooms);
158            connections = doorways = d.asCoords();
159            mouths = new Coord[0];
160            List<GreasedRegion> rs = allRooms.split(), cs = allCorridors.split();
161
162            for (GreasedRegion sep : cs) {
163                GreasedRegion someDoors = sep.copy().fringe().and(allRooms);
164                Coord[] doors = someDoors.asCoords();
165                List<GreasedRegion> near = new ArrayList<>(4);
166                for (int i = 0; i < doors.length; i++) {
167                    near.addAll(GreasedRegion.whichContain(doors[i].x, doors[i].y, rs));
168                }
169                corridors.put(sep, near);
170            }
171
172            for (GreasedRegion sep : rs) {
173                GreasedRegion aroundDoors = sep.copy().fringe().and(allCorridors);
174                Coord[] doors = aroundDoors.asCoords();
175                List<GreasedRegion> near = new ArrayList<>(10);
176                for (int i = 0; i < doors.length; i++) {
177                    near.addAll(GreasedRegion.whichContain(doors[i].x, doors[i].y, cs));
178                }
179                rooms.put(sep, near);
180            }
181        }
182        else
183        {
184            allCaves = new GreasedRegion(basic, '.');
185            allFloors = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
186            allRooms = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
187            allCorridors = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
188            caves.put(allCaves, new ArrayList<GreasedRegion>());
189            connections = mouths = allCaves.copy().andNot(allCaves.copy().retract8way()).retract().asCoords();
190            doorways = new Coord[0];
191            environment = allCaves.writeInts(environment, DungeonUtility.CAVE_FLOOR);
192
193        }
194    }
195
196    /**
197     * Constructs a RoomFinder given a dungeon map and an environment map (which currently is only produced by
198     * MixedGenerator by the getEnvironment() method after generate() is called, but other classes that use
199     * MixedGenerator may also expose that environment, such as SerpentMapGenerator.getEnvironment()), and finds rooms,
200     * corridors, caves, and their connections on the map.
201     * @param dungeon a 2D char array that uses '#' for walls.
202     * @param environment a 2D int array using constants from MixedGenerator; typically produced by a call to
203     *                    getEnvironment() in MixedGenerator or SerpentMapGenerator after dungeon generation.
204     */
205    public RoomFinder(char[][] dungeon, int[][] environment)
206    {
207        if(dungeon.length <= 0)
208            return;
209        width = dungeon.length;
210        height = dungeon[0].length;
211        map = new char[width][height];
212        this.environment = ArrayTools.copy(environment);
213        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
214            System.arraycopy(dungeon[i], 0, map[i], 0, height);
215        }
216
217        rooms = new OrderedMap<>(32);
218        corridors = new OrderedMap<>(32);
219        caves = new OrderedMap<>(32);
220        basic = DungeonUtility.simplifyDungeon(map);
221        allFloors = new GreasedRegion(basic, '.');
222        allRooms = new GreasedRegion(environment, DungeonUtility.ROOM_FLOOR);
223        allCorridors = new GreasedRegion(environment, DungeonUtility.CORRIDOR_FLOOR);
224        allCaves = new GreasedRegion(environment, DungeonUtility.CAVE_FLOOR);
225        GreasedRegion d = allCorridors.copy().fringe().and(allRooms),
226                m = allCaves.copy().fringe().and(allRooms.copy().or(allCorridors));
227        doorways = d.asCoords();
228        mouths = m.asCoords();
229        connections = new Coord[doorways.length + mouths.length];
230        System.arraycopy(doorways, 0, connections, 0, doorways.length);
231        System.arraycopy(mouths, 0, connections, doorways.length, mouths.length);
232
233        List<GreasedRegion> rs = allRooms.split(), cs = allCorridors.split(), vs = allCaves.split();
234
235        for (GreasedRegion sep : cs) {
236            GreasedRegion someDoors = sep.copy().fringe().and(allRooms);
237            Coord[] doors = someDoors.asCoords();
238            List<GreasedRegion> near = new ArrayList<>(16);
239            for (int i = 0; i < doors.length; i++) {
240                near.addAll(GreasedRegion.whichContain(doors[i].x, doors[i].y, rs));
241            }
242            someDoors.remake(sep).fringe().and(allCaves);
243            doors = someDoors.asCoords();
244            for (int i = 0; i < doors.length; i++) {
245                near.addAll(GreasedRegion.whichContain(doors[i].x, doors[i].y, vs));
246            }
247            corridors.put(sep, near);
248        }
249
250        for (GreasedRegion sep : rs) {
251            GreasedRegion aroundDoors = sep.copy().fringe().and(allCorridors);
252            Coord[] doors = aroundDoors.asCoords();
253            List<GreasedRegion> near = new ArrayList<>(32);
254            for (int i = 0; i < doors.length; i++) {
255                near.addAll(GreasedRegion.whichContain(doors[i].x, doors[i].y, cs));
256            }
257            aroundDoors.remake(sep).fringe().and(allCaves);
258            doors = aroundDoors.asCoords();
259            for (int i = 0; i < doors.length; i++) {
260                near.addAll(GreasedRegion.whichContain(doors[i].x, doors[i].y, vs));
261            }
262            rooms.put(sep, near);
263        }
264        for (GreasedRegion sep : vs) {
265            GreasedRegion aroundMouths = sep.copy().fringe().and(allCorridors);
266            Coord[] maws = aroundMouths.asCoords();
267            List<GreasedRegion> near = new ArrayList<>(48);
268            for (int i = 0; i < maws.length; i++) {
269                near.addAll(GreasedRegion.whichContain(maws[i].x, maws[i].y, cs));
270            }
271            aroundMouths.remake(sep).fringe().and(allRooms);
272            maws = aroundMouths.asCoords();
273            for (int i = 0; i < maws.length; i++) {
274                near.addAll(GreasedRegion.whichContain(maws[i].x, maws[i].y, rs));
275            }
276            caves.put(sep, near);
277        }
278    }
279
280    /**
281     * Gets all the rooms this found during construction, returning them as an ArrayList of 2D char arrays, where an
282     * individual room is "masked" so only its contents have normal map chars and the rest have only '#'.
283     * @return an ArrayList of 2D char arrays representing rooms.
284     */
285    public ArrayList<char[][]> findRooms()
286    {
287        ArrayList<char[][]> rs = new ArrayList<>(rooms.size());
288        for(GreasedRegion r : rooms.keySet())
289        {
290            rs.add(r.mask(map, '#'));
291        }
292        return rs;
293    }
294
295    /**
296     * Gets all the corridors this found during construction, returning them as an ArrayList of 2D char arrays, where an
297     * individual corridor is "masked" so only its contents have normal map chars and the rest have only '#'.
298     * @return an ArrayList of 2D char arrays representing corridors.
299     */
300    public ArrayList<char[][]> findCorridors()
301    {
302        ArrayList<char[][]> cs = new ArrayList<>(corridors.size());
303        for(GreasedRegion c : corridors.keySet())
304        {
305            cs.add(c.mask(map, '#'));
306        }
307        return cs;
308    }
309
310    /**
311     * Gets all the caves this found during construction, returning them as an ArrayList of 2D char arrays, where an
312     * individual room is "masked" so only its contents have normal map chars and the rest have only '#'. Will only
313     * return a non-empty collection if the two-arg constructor was used and the environment contains caves.
314     * @return an ArrayList of 2D char arrays representing caves.
315     */
316    public ArrayList<char[][]> findCaves()
317    {
318        ArrayList<char[][]> vs = new ArrayList<>(caves.size());
319        for(GreasedRegion v : caves.keySet())
320        {
321            vs.add(v.mask(map, '#'));
322        }
323        return vs;
324    }
325    /**
326     * Gets all the rooms, corridors, and caves this found during construction, returning them as an ArrayList of 2D
327     * char arrays, where an individual room or corridor is "masked" so only its contents have normal map chars and the
328     * rest have only '#'.
329     * @return an ArrayList of 2D char arrays representing rooms, corridors, or caves.
330     */
331    public ArrayList<char[][]> findRegions()
332    {
333        ArrayList<char[][]> rs = new ArrayList<char[][]>(rooms.size() + corridors.size() + caves.size());
334        for(GreasedRegion r : rooms.keySet())
335        {
336            rs.add(r.mask(map, '#'));
337        }
338        for(GreasedRegion c : corridors.keySet())
339        {
340            rs.add(c.mask(map, '#'));
341        }
342        for(GreasedRegion v : caves.keySet())
343        {
344            rs.add(v.mask(map, '#'));
345        }
346        return rs;
347    }
348    private static char[][] defaultFill(int width, int height)
349    {
350        char[][] d = new char[width][height];
351        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
352            Arrays.fill(d[x], '#');
353        }
354        return d;
355    }
356
357    /**
358     * Merges multiple 2D char arrays where the '#' character means "no value", and combines them so all cells with
359     * value are on one map, with '#' filling any other cells. If regions is empty, this uses width and height to
360     * construct a blank map, all '#'. It will also use width and height for the size of the returned 2D array.
361     * @param regions An ArrayList of 2D char array regions, where '#' is an empty value and all others will be merged
362     * @param width the width of any map this returns
363     * @param height the height of any map this returns
364     * @return a 2D char array that merges all non-'#' areas in regions, and fills the rest with '#'
365     */
366    public static char[][] merge(ArrayList<char[][]> regions, int width, int height)
367    {
368        if(regions == null || regions.isEmpty())
369            return defaultFill(width, height);
370        char[][] first = regions.get(0);
371        char[][] dungeon = new char[Math.min(width, first.length)][Math.min(height, first[0].length)];
372        for (int x = 0; x < first.length; x++) {
373            Arrays.fill(dungeon[x], '#');
374        }
375        for(char[][] region : regions)
376        {
377            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
378                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
379                    if(region[x][y] != '#')
380                        dungeon[x][y] = region[x][y];
381                }
382            }
383        }
384        return dungeon;
385    }
386
387    /**
388     * Takes an x, y position and finds the room, corridor, or cave at that position, if there is one, returning the
389     * same 2D char array format as the other methods.
390     * @param x the x coordinate of a position that should be in a room or corridor
391     * @param y the y coordinate of a position that should be in a room or corridor
392     * @return a masked 2D char array where anything not in the current region is '#'
393     */
394    public char[][] regionAt(int x, int y)
395    {
396
397        OrderedSet<GreasedRegion> regions = GreasedRegion.whichContain(x, y, rooms.keySet());
398        regions.addAll(GreasedRegion.whichContain(x, y, corridors.keySet()));
399        regions.addAll(GreasedRegion.whichContain(x, y, caves.keySet()));
400        GreasedRegion found;
401        if(regions.isEmpty())
402            found = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
403        else
404            found = regions.first();
405        return found.mask(map, '#');
406    }
407
408    /**
409     * Takes an x, y position and finds the room or corridor at that position and the rooms, corridors or caves that it
410     * directly connects to, and returns the group as one merged 2D char array.
411     * @param x the x coordinate of a position that should be in a room or corridor
412     * @param y the y coordinate of a position that should be in a room or corridor
413     * @return a masked 2D char array where anything not in the current region or one nearby is '#'
414     */
415    public char[][] regionsNear(int x, int y)
416    {
417        OrderedSet<GreasedRegion> atRooms = GreasedRegion.whichContain(x, y, rooms.keySet()),
418                atCorridors = GreasedRegion.whichContain(x, y, corridors.keySet()),
419                atCaves = GreasedRegion.whichContain(x, y, caves.keySet()),
420                regions = new OrderedSet<>(64);
421        regions.addAll(atRooms);
422        regions.addAll(atCorridors);
423        regions.addAll(atCaves);
424        GreasedRegion found;
425        if(regions.isEmpty())
426            found = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
427        else
428        {
429            found = regions.first();
430            List<List<GreasedRegion>> near = rooms.getMany(atRooms);
431            for (List<GreasedRegion> links : near) {
432                for(GreasedRegion n : links)
433                {
434                    found.or(n);
435                }
436            }
437            near = corridors.getMany(atCorridors);
438            for (List<GreasedRegion> links : near) {
439                for(GreasedRegion n : links)
440                {
441                    found.or(n);
442                }
443            }
444            near = caves.getMany(atCaves);
445            for (List<GreasedRegion> links : near) {
446                for(GreasedRegion n : links)
447                {
448                    found.or(n);
449                }
450            }
451        }
452        return found.mask(map, '#');
453    }
454
455    /**
456     * Takes an x, y position and finds the rooms or corridors that are directly connected to the room, corridor or cave
457     * at that position, and returns the group as an ArrayList of 2D char arrays, one per connecting region.
458     * @param x the x coordinate of a position that should be in a room or corridor
459     * @param y the y coordinate of a position that should be in a room or corridor
460     * @return an ArrayList of masked 2D char arrays where anything not in a connected region is '#'
461     */
462    public ArrayList<char[][]> regionsConnected(int x, int y)
463    {
464        ArrayList<char[][]> regions = new ArrayList<>(10);
465        List<List<GreasedRegion>> near = rooms.getMany(GreasedRegion.whichContain(x, y, rooms.keySet()));
466        for (List<GreasedRegion> links : near) {
467            for(GreasedRegion n : links)
468            {
469                regions.add(n.mask(map, '#'));
470            }
471        }
472        near = corridors.getMany(GreasedRegion.whichContain(x, y, corridors.keySet()));
473        for (List<GreasedRegion> links : near) {
474            for (GreasedRegion n : links) {
475                regions.add(n.mask(map, '#'));
476            }
477        }
478        near = caves.getMany(GreasedRegion.whichContain(x, y, caves.keySet()));
479        for (List<GreasedRegion> links : near) {
480            for(GreasedRegion n : links)
481            {
482                regions.add(n.mask(map, '#'));
483            }
484        }
485
486        return regions;
487    }
488}
